channel.title: Gallery on Evan Buggy
channel.description: Recent content in Gallery on Evan Buggy

item.title: Tutorial Level - Green Chaos
item.description: These are some assorted views of the model for the tutorial level from Green Chaos. The bottom image is a bird’s eye view of the entire thing. It’s a unique angle you wouldn’t be able to see during normal gameplay.

item.title: StreetPass
item.description: This drawing was originally made for a 3DS and StreetPass themes coffee morning at my university.

item.title: Ending Screen - The Green Escape
item.description: This is the ending screen found at the end of The Green Escape.

item.title: Funky Kong
item.description: A render of Funky Kong I did to promote a Mario Kart Wii tournament at my unviersity. I did an entire promotional video for it too, but you’ll just have to try dig that up by yourself…

item.title: Mirror Room
item.description: To brush up on my painting skills, I painted a segment of the mirror room from Super Mario 64. I really like how this one came out, but I would love to do even more someday. I never had the intention of painting an entire shot of the room.

item.title: Chibi Protagonist
item.description: A chibi version of a character design I had a couple of years back.

item.title: Tower Plane
item.description: This gif has a neat little history. This is actually my very first 3D model. I made it in Sketchup at the age of 13 and used it in a Super Mario 64 ROM Hack. I have a video (albeit a very poor quality one) showcasing it here. One day as I was digging up some old files, I found it again and decided to “recycle” it. By messing around with a bunch of settings in the Eevee renderer, I was able to create this cool looking effect that makes it look straight out of a Super FX game. I think I will repeat this process for some of my other level models or find some other ways to make them look cool!

item.title: BeatWarez
item.description: This animation was made as a proof of concept for an old point and click game I used to work on when I was younger.

item.title: Spamton
item.description: I believe this is the last piece I ever made that was something to post on social media. Most of what I do and draw now is meant for larger projects, or just concept art and doodles.

item.title: Browser Girl
item.description: This is concept art I made for a character from a point and click game I developed when I was younger. She is meant to characterise an internet browser.

item.title: Browser Girl Concept Art
item.description: Typically when I do character design, the first thing I do is write down aspects and traits of their personality to help me visualise them.

item.title: Peach - Unused Odyssey Outfit
item.description: A drawing of Peach with an outfit from “The Art of Super Mario Odyssey”.

item.title: Raymond
item.description: I was one of the very lucky few with Raymond on their island during New Horizons’ peak in the spring of 2020. Honestly, I mainly wanted him so I could steal his office furniture.

item.title: Dreambert
item.description: A drawing of Dreambert from Mario and Luigi Dream Team I did for a friend. They used him as a profile picture all the time.

item.title: Susie
item.description: A very old drawing of mine, from when I was 15. One of the few ones I am still proud of from way back when. As of writing this, I am 21 and chapter 3 is still not out…
